suggestions.suggestion: First, secure your account immediately by calling BPI's 24/7 Customer Service hotline (89-100) or using the BPI Mobile App to lock your lost debit card. This prevents unauthorized transactions while you arrange for a replacement.

Visit any BPI branch with at least one valid, unexpired government-issued photo ID (PhilID, Passport, Driver's License, SSS ID, PRC ID, or UMID) to request a replacement card. You can set your branch appointment online at https://www.bpi.com.ph/personal/bank/digital-banking/online/bea-online to minimize waiting time.

Replacement card fees may apply depending on your account type. Check with the branch staff for the exact amount. If you're a BPI Preferred client, you may enjoy priority handling and potentially waived fees - inquire about BPI Preferred Priority Handling services.

While waiting for your replacement card, you can continue banking using BPI Online or the BPI Mobile App for fund transfers, bill payments, and balance inquiries. The app also allows you to monitor your account for any unauthorized transactions.

For immediate assistance, contact BPI through: 1) 24/7 hotline 89-100, 2) BPI Facebook Messenger, 3) Email via the Contact Us page at https://www.bpi.com.ph/about-bpi/contact-us, or 4) Visit any branch. Report the loss as soon as possible to protect your account.

history.content: Can I request a replacement online?

Yes, you can request a replacement debit card entirely through the BPI Mobile App. Open the app, go to 'Account Settings' → 'Card Management' → select the lost card → 'Lock Card' (if not already done) → then tap 'Request Replacement Card'. You'll need to confirm your delivery address and pay the replacement fee using your enrolled BPI account. The app will show real-time status updates and estimated delivery (typically 5-7 banking days within Metro Manila).

You'll need to confirm your delivery address and pay the replacement fee using your enrolled BPI account. The app will show real-time status updates and estimated delivery (typically 5-7 banking days within Metro Manila).

Before requesting replacement, ensure you've locked your lost card via the app's 'Card Management' feature. The BPI Mobile App uses biometric login (fingerprint/Face ID) and OTP verification for card replacement requests. After requesting replacement, monitor your account through the app's 'Transaction History' - any suspicious activity can be reported immediately through the in-app 'Contact Us' feature.

While waiting for your replacement card, you can continue transacting digitally. The BPI Mobile App allows QR code payments via 'QR Ph' at merchants, online purchases using 'BPI Online Banking' as payment method, and fund transfers to other accounts. Your virtual card details (accessible in 'Card Management') can be used for online transactions until your physical card arrives.

history.content: How long does it take to get a new one?

Your replacement debit card will normally arrive within 5–7 banking days if your delivery address is in Metro Manila.  The BPI Mobile App will display the exact estimated delivery date once you submit the replacement request, and you can track the card’s status in real time under Card Management.
